attributes.action: GP should listen to more than 1 problem in 1 appointment
attributes.background: I have noticed that the time given for each appointment was 10 min but quite often my consultation lasted less than 5 min and to discuss another problem I had to book a new appointment which could have been delt with in 2-3 min at same time. Proper use of 10 min will help to decrease load on NHS.

rejection.details:
Decisions about time management during appointments is one for individual GPs, not the UK Government or Parliament. You could raise this issue with your local GP practice directly. 

You could also contact your local NHS Clinical Commissioning Group about this issue. You can find out how to contact them here: 

https://www.england.nhs.uk/resources/ccg-directory/
